snippet: Astronomers looking back 13.8 billion years found ripples in the fabric of space-time that support the theory of a universe being wrenched violently apart around its inception.
abstract: Astronomers looking back 13.8 billion years find ripples in the fabric of space-time that support theory of inflation, which explains how universe violently expanded so uniformly and quickly in instant after Big Bang; if corroborated, work will stand as landmark in science comparable to recent discovery of dark energy or of Big Bang itself.
lead_paragraph: Astronomers looking back 13.8 billion years found ripples in the fabric of space-time that support the theory of a universe being wrenched violently apart around its inception.

headline.main: Space Ripples Reveal Big Bang’s Smoking Gun
